messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Better than e-mail lists
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m just the opposite.  I prefer email lists because I can read it all off line and then send off my answers all at once.  I suppose if we had
messages.messageBody:
At 02:29 PM 21/12/2001 -0500, you wrote:
>Christmas wish from Sandra: I wish more of you would participate at
>www.unschooling.com
>
>For my own preferences, I like the forum (with its library and message
>boards) ten times more than any list, so if any of you here are wondering
>what to do with your excess unschooling-discussion energy, it would be
>beneficial to the world at large for you to contribute ideas and experiences
>at that forum.

I'm just the opposite. I prefer email lists because I can read it all off
line and then send off my answers all at once. I suppose if we had
cable......but I don't really want cable.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Better than e-mail lists
messages.msgSnippet: Christmas wish from Sandra:  I wish more of you would participate at www.unschooling.com For my own preferences, I like the forum (with its library and message
messages.messageBody:
Christmas wish from Sandra: I wish more of you would participate at
www.unschooling.com

For my own preferences, I like the forum (with its library and message
boards) ten times more than any list, so if any of you here are wondering
what to do with your excess unschooling-discussion energy, it would be
beneficial to the world at large for you to contribute ideas and experiences
at that forum.

Here's how I get there myself:

http://www.unschooling.com/cgi/discus/board-newmessages.cgi


It's straight to the new messages screen; I saved it as a link.

If you're in the forum through the front door, though, "New Messages" is a
button in a box of options at the bottom of each page of the message board.

Sandra
